    "name": "Initial prime of a prime chain of length n under the iteration x->5x+6.",
    "comment": [
        "This is a special case of prime chains generated by f(x) = cx + d.",
        "a(11) > 8695354111. [From _Donovan Johnson_, Sep 27 2008]"
    ],
    "reference": [
        "D. H. Lehmer, On certain chains of primes, Proc. London Math. Soc. (3) 14a 1965 183-186."
    ],
    "example": [
        "a(3) = 13 since 7, f(7) = 41, and f(41) = 211 are primes when f(x) = 5*x + 6."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "c[p_] := Block[{k=1, q = 5*p+6}, While[PrimeQ[q], q = 5*q+6; k++]; k]; a[n_] := Block[{p = 2}, While[c[p] < n, p = NextPrime[p]]; p]; Array[a, 7] (* _Giovanni Resta_, Mar 22 2017 *)"
    ],
